page.title: 07 BUILDINGS:E.BUDLEIGH (1)
page.content: 1.{Bicton House}There has been a manor & chapel on the site since Saxon times. The medieval manor was replaced by a tudor mansion built by Sir Robert Dennys.This was demolished by John Rolle & the present Georgian mansion built by his sons.The gardens were laid out in 1735 after plans by{LeNotre}who designed{Versailles.}An{obelisk}was added as a "point de vue" to the land- scape.In 1812 the lake was built by french prisoners.In 1850 a new StMary's church was built & later the Shell & Orangery houses added.Finally,in 1908, Tapper altered the house to make it seem more Georgian.GeorgeIV spent part of his honeymoon here.The house is now a{College of Agri & Horticulture.} 2.{Vicars Mead}-this medieval thatched cottage was the vicarage until 1852 & was long connected with smuggling in the area. By J.Ross & A.Kain
